title: Machine Learning and Optimization Techniques for Designing Lead-Free Piezoelectric Ceramics

context.prior_knowledge: Solid-State Physics, Basic Materials Science, Introduction to Machine Learning, and Statistical Modeling
context.additional_context: Real-time visualization of piezoelectric materials' electromechanical properties in a VR environment, with a project to develop personalized optimization algorithms based on BYOD

learning_goals: Students can build and validate an MLPR model to predict the dielectric constant (ε′) and dielectric loss (tan δ) of piezoelectric ceramics.
Students can derive Pareto-optimal points that simultaneously maximize ε′ and minimize tan δ using the NSGA-II algorithm.
Learners can quantitatively analyze the impact of CaTiO3 concentration (x% Ca), frequency, and temperature variables on piezoelectric properties.

resources: Piezoelectric Material Database and Simulation Tool
Distributed Computing Resources (for Optimization Algorithm Execution)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
